cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northwest then northwest toward the South Carolina coast, expected to curve north-northeast up the Carolina coastline and offshore early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina near or just north of Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina coasts including Cape Fear and the lower Outer Banks
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 2–4 inches, locally up to 4 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible from Saturday afternoon through Sunday near Wilmington
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation and dangerous rip currents possible, but surge heights generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain with totals of 2–4 inches through the weekend could cause localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and life-threatening rip currents along nearby beaches
